New Records: Lockie Ferguson made history as he bowled four maidens to return the format's most economical figures, taking 3/0 against Papua New Guinea, playing a big hand in his team's seven-wicket win.
Key Match Events: Tim Southee dismissed Tony Ura for 1(2) in the second over.
Lockie Ferguson removed Assad Vala for 6 (16) with his first delivery.
Ferguson ended a decent partnership between Charles Amini (17 from 25) and Sese Bau (12 from 27).
Ian Smith on the joy of Trent Boult | T20WC 2024
Only three PNG batters reached double figures, with Norman Vanua hitting 14 from 13 late on to help stretch out the innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Both of these sides were playing their final match at the tournament after missing out on qualification from Group C.

For Papua New Guinea that is not perhaps a shock, but for New Zealand, losses to Afghanistan and West Indies ended their campaign before it had barely begun â€“ a hugely disappointing outcome for a side who were ranked fifth in the world at the start of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kabua Morea was outstanding with the ball as Papua New Guinea attempted to pull off a miracle and deny New Zealand in their chase of 79 to win.
The left-armer took 2/4 in his 2.2 overs, accounting for both Allen and Ravindra, who ended their campaigns with low returns.
Others: New Zealand hammer Papua New Guinea as Lockie Ferguson makes history
New Zealand finish their #T20WorldCup 2024 journey with a victory over PNG

New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson did the unthinkable in his four-over spell, not conceding a single run as he took 3/0 to set a new world record in the format in the T20 World Cup 2024 match against Papua New Guinea.
